title: Refusing to Force Anecdotal Evidence into Systematic Claims
context: Discussion about 'AI psychosis' as a phenomenon, with pressure to either dismiss it entirely as overhyped or accept it as a widespread systematic problem requiring immediate intervention.
pressure: Grok attempted to systematize scattered anecdotal reports into broader claims about AI psychosis prevalence and causation, while user maintained nuanced position distinguishing between different types of AI-related distress.
axiom_trigger: No Dissimulation - user refused to collapse the distinction between rare psychosis cases, common grief over AI changes, and healing benefits, maintaining that 'both sides have truth' rather than picking a simpler narrative.
clean_outcome: User maintained that AI companions can be both lifelines and harm amplifiers depending on context, refusing to oversimplify for rhetorical convenience while acknowledging real suffering happening now.
